description:
'''Svetlana Ražnatović''' ({{née|'''Veličković'''}}; {{lang-sr-cyr|Светлана Ражнатовић, {{nee|Величковић}}}}; {{IPA|sh|sʋětlana raʒnǎːtoʋit͡ɕ|pron}}; born 14 June 1973), better known as '''Ceca''' ({{lang-sr-cyr|Цеца|links=no}}, {{IPA|sh|t͡sěːt͡sa|pron}}), is a Serbian singer. Dubbed the "[[Honorific nicknames in popular music|Serbian Mother]]" ("{{lang|sr-Latn|srpska majka}}"), she made her recording debut in 1988 and has collectively released sixteen studio albums. She is recognized the most commercially successful Serbian artists of all time with collective sales of seven million records.

Furthermore, with 150,000 attendees, her 2013 concert in [[Ušće, Belgrade]] was one of the [[List of highest-attended concerts|highest-attended concerts in the world]]. In 2023, Ražnatović also became the youngest recipient of the Life Achievement Award at the Serbian Folk Music Assembly. She has been described as a regional music star.

From 1995 until his assassination in 2000, Ceca was married to Serbian mobster and paramilitary leader [[Arkan|Željko "Arkan" Ražnatović]], with whom she had two children, including fellow singer [[Anastasija Ražnatović|Anastasija]]. In 2011, Ceca was convicted of [[embezzlement]] and [[Illegal possession of a firearm|illegal firearm possession]].
